name: Ballyhoo Single Grain Whiskey
description: A small-batch single grain Irish whiskey, Ballyhoo is made with a mash bill of 93% corn and 7% malted barley and matured for four years, before being finished in ex-port for six months. Aromas of vanilla, almonds, baking spices and green apples fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla, dried fruit, rich nuts, caramel and toasted oak throughout the palate.
subtitle: Irish Single Grain Whiskey

name: Bushmills 10 Year Old
description:
The benchmark Irish single malt, this has a far greater depth of flavour than standard Irish blends.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whiskey

name:
Bushmills 2000 Port Cask
Causeway Collection
description: A limited-edition 2000 port cask matured Bushmills single malt Irish whiskey from the Causeway Collection, a series of whiskies inspired by the majesty of Ireland's picturesque Giant's Causeway. This whiskey has spent its entire life in first-fill ruby port casks, and two decades in these casks has imparted aromas of ripe raspberries, plums, grapefruit and cherries that fill the nose. The palate offers notes of strawberries, caramelised toffee, sweet chilli, allspice and raspberry jam the linger in the finish.
subtitle: Single Malt Irish Whiskey

name: Bushmills 21 Year Old
description: Matured in a combination of hand-selected oloroso sherry butts and ex-bourbon barrels for at least 19 years, this 21-year-old single malt Irish whiskey from Bushmills is then finished in Madeira casks for a further two years. Rich aromas of honey, ripe summer fruits, sweet hazelnuts and cacao fill the nose, complemented by notes of dark chocolate, toffee, vanilla, toasted nuts and charred oak throughout the palate and lingering in the finish.
subtitle: Single Malt Irish Whiskey

name: Bushmills Caribbean Rum Cask Finish
description: A fruity, spicy Irish whiskey from Bushmills that has been matured in casks that previously held Dominican rum. Aromas of pineapple, mango and oak spice fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla custard, cream, caramelised pineapple and papaya throughout the palate.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Bushmills Black Bush
description: A bottle of a rich, dark, Irish blend, Black Bush contains a high proportion of triple-distilled single malt, aged in Oloroso sherry casks for around eight to 10 years before marriage with the grain.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name:
Bushmills 16 Year Old Single Malt
 Port Finish
description: Matured in three different types of cask - oloroso sherry, bourbon , and port pipes - each of which contributes extra nuances to what is destined to become a classic Irish malt. Perfect as an after-dinner dram.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whiskey

name: Bushmills Original
description: Grain whiskey reserved for Bushmills Original is slowly matured for a minimum of five years in American oak casks before blending with Irish Single Malt to produce this popular whiskey.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Bushmills Bourbon Cask Finish
description: A bold Irish whiskey from Bushmills that has been finished in bourbon casks, creating layers of vanilla and oak spice throughout the palate.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Bushmills Red Bush
description: Bushmills is a very traditional distillery and its rare to see a new expression – this was the first to appear for almost five years! It's a sweet and buttery dram with lots of vanilla and cream, as you'd expect from its maturation in bourbon casks, with lots of first-fill in the mix.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

Bushmills 16 Year Old
Three Wood

name:
Clonakilty Single Grain Irish Whiskey
Bordeaux Wine Finish
description: A single grain Irish whiskey from Clonakilty, finished in ex-Bordeaux wine casks. Sweet aromas of raspberries, rhubarb and custard fill the nose, complimenting notes of strawberries, cream, honey and wood spice throughout the palate.
subtitle: Single Grain Irish Whiskey

name: Clonakilty Port Cask Irish Whiskey
description: A triple distilled blended Irish whiskey from Clonakilty's Cask Finish Series, finished in port casks. Aromas of ripe peaches, lively citrus, creamy vanilla and delicate oak spice fill the nose, complimented by notes of cardamom, chilli, peach compote and orange zest on the palate.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Clonakilty Single Batch Irish Whiskey
description: A single batch Irish whiskey from Clonakilty, finished in virgin oak casks and matured in a warehouse overlooking the Atlantic Ocean. Soft aromas of sweet spices, freshly-cut grass, ripe orchard fruits and leather fill the nose, and the palate offers notes of fresh ginger, cubeb pepper, hazelnut, almond and grass.
subtitle: Irish Whiskey

name:
Connacht Single Malt Whiskey
Batch 1
description: The first batch of single malt Irish whiskey from Connacht has been matured in ex-bourbon barrels and finished in sherry casks from Jerez. Aromas of raisins, dried fruit, honey, fudge, butterscotch, almond and star anise fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla, malt, dried fruit, baking spices, walnuts and honey throughout the palate.
subtitle: Single Malt Irish Whiskey

name: Connemara Peated Irish Whiskey
description:
Thought peat was all about Islay? Think (or perhaps that should be 'drink') again. All Islay fans owe it to themselves to check out Connemara from the splendid Cooley distillery.

Tasting Notes (3)
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whiskey

name: Connemara 12 Year Old Peated Irish Whiskey
description: The oldest expression in the Connemara range, this fine 12 Year Old peated Irish single malt from the Cooley distillery has won several awards including a Gold medal at the San Francisco World Spirits Fair.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whiskey

name:
Connemara Distillers Edition Peated
Gift Pack
description: A gift pack containing a bottle of Connemara's excellent, but now discontinued, Distillers Edition Peated Single Malt and two branded tumblers to enjoy it from. A superb alternative to an Islay malt with a light and earthier style of peating.
subtitle: Distillery Bottling

name:
Cooley 2002
19 Year Old Gleann Mor Rare Find
description: A 2002 Cooley Irish single malt from indie bottler Gleann Mor, finished in an ex-rum cask and bottled in 2021 as part of its Rare Finds series. Aromas buttery caramel, banana fritters and pineapple fill the nose, complemented by notes of pear drops, dates, raisins and peppery oak throughout the palate.
subtitle:
Irish Single Malt Whiskey
Gleann Mor

name:
Currach Single Malt Whiskey
 Atlantic Kombu Seaweed Cask
description: An Irish single malt whiskey from Origin Spirits, Currach has been matured in ex-bourbon barrels and finished for three months in virgin oak casks charred with Atlantic Kombu seaweed. Aromas of toffee, raisins, almond and smoky seaweed fill the nose, followed by notes of roast coffee, salted caramel, dark chocolate, nutty smoke and earthy umami on the palate.
subtitle: Single Malt Irish Whiskey

name: Dingle Whisky Batch 5
description: The fifth release of single malt Irish whiskey from Dingle Distillery has been matured in a combination of ex-bourbon, Pedro Ximenez sherry and Madeira wine casks. Aromas of crème brulee, salted caramel and honeycomb fill the nose, complemented by notes of sun-dried raisins, blossom honey, Tiramisu and vanilla throughout the palate.
subtitle:
Irish Single Malt Whiskey
Distillery Bottling

name: Dingle Single Malt Whiskey
description: A triple distilled Irish single malt whiskey from Dingle Distillery that has been matured in a combination of ex-bourbon and ex-Pedro Ximenez sherry casks. Aromas of lime zest, freshly-picked mint leaves and sweet pears fill the nose, complemented by notes of caramelised apple slices, raisins, vanilla, honey and mixed spices throughout the finish.
subtitle: Single Malt Irish Whiskey

name:
Dingle Single Pot Still
2nd Release
description:
The second single pot still release from Dingle eschews the sherry-heavy maturation of its predecessor, instead opting for a 60/20/20 split between bourbon, PX and oloroso cask maturation, lending Dingle's spirit notes of fresh orchard fruit, a touch of zesty citrus and a hint of spice.


The first in a new wave of boutique, artisan Irish distilleries, Dingle was established in 2012 with a focus on producing high-quality, flavoursome spirit, and has experienced impressive demand for its whisky since releasing its first batch in 2015.
subtitle:
Irish Single Pot Still Whiskey
Distillery Bottling

name: Drumshanbo Galanta Single Malt Whisky
description: Drumshanbo Galanta is the first single malt Irish whiskey to be distilled in Ireland's wester province of Connacht in more than 107 years. Aromas of caramel, toffee, roasted nuts and oaky vanilla fill the nose, complemented by notes of honey, sweet apples, roasted nuts, peppery spice and oak throughout the palate.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whiskey

name:
Dublin Liberties Copper Alley
10 Year Old
description: The Dublin Liberties Copper Alley is aged initially in bourbon barrels for 10 years, before being finished for six months in oloroso-sherry casks. his has enticing notes of chocolate, raisins and nuts.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whiskey

name:
Dublin Liberties
Oak Devil
description:
The Dublin Liberties is a blended Irish whiskey from Quintessential Brands. Inspired by the eponymous area of the Irish capital, this has been aged in bourbon casks and is filled with notes of caramel, Christmas cake and pepper.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name:
Dubliner Irish Whisky
Bourbon Cask
description: The Dubliner's blended whiskey is aged exclusively in bourbon casks. Mellow and rounded with notes of honey and a hint of pepper, this is a great introduction to Irish whiskey.
subtitle: Irish Blended Whiskey

name: Dunphy's
description: Dunphy's is an Irish blend made by Midleton, originally for the US market, but now available on this side of the pond.
subtitle: No subtitle

name: Dunville's 1808 Blended Irish Whiskey
description: A modern blended Irish whiskey from Dunville's, 1808 is a bold combination of grain, malt and pot still whiskey that has a fruity, spicy character. Aromas of creamy vanilla, crunchy apples, pears, lemon curd, malt and lemon zest fill the nose, complemented by notes of buttery cereals, freshly-baked biscuits, ripe oranges, lemon meringue pie, charred oak and white pepper throughout the palate and wisps of smoke lingering in the finish.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name:
Dunville's 12 Year Old
PX Cask
description: Dunville's 12 Year Old has ben aged in Pedro-Ximenez casks and bottled at Echlinville Distillery. The result is a sweet and lightly spicy whiskey with notes of bubblegum, custard and green apples.
subtitle: Single Malt Irish Whiskey

name: Dunville's Three Crowns Whiskey
description:
Dunville's Three Crowns is a historic brand of Irish whiskey which has been revived by Echlinville distillery. Sweet and spicy with notes of dried fruit, vanilla and walnut.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Dunville's Three Crowns Peated Whiskey
description: Duneville's Three Crowns Peated Irish whiskey is a sweet, fruity and gently smoky blend. Aromas of butterscotch, milk chocolate and vanilla fill the nose, and the palate offers notes of honey, mocha, stewed pears, earthy peat smoke and dried apricots.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Egan's Vintage Grain
description: Matured for at least eight years in ex-bourbon barrels, this single grain Irish whiskey from Egan's has a smooth, sweet character. The palate offers notes of vanilla, oak, fudge and a hint of spice.
subtitle:
Irish Single Grain Whiskey
Egan's

name: Egan's Legacy Reserve 18 Year Old
description: An 18-year-old Egan's Legacy Reserve Irish single malt whiskey that was matured for 17 years in ex-bourbon barrels, before being finished for a year in Moscatel DE Valencia casks. The palate offers notes of orange, nougat, apricot, honey, jasmine and black pepper that linger in the finish.
subtitle: Single Malt Irish Whiskey

name: Egan's Fortitude Single Malt
description: Matured exclusively in Pedro Ximenez casks, this Irish single malt whiskey has a rich, fruity character with a clear sherry influence. Aromas of honey, raisins, marzipan, sherry and cinnamon fill the nose, complimenting notes of dried fruit, sultanas, plums and nutmeg throughout the palate.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whiskey

name: Egan's Single Malt Whiskey 10 Year Old
description: Made at an undisclosed distillery in Ireland, Egan's 10 Year Old single malt Irish whiskey has been matured in American oak casks. Soft aromas of apples, cinnamon, nutmeg and ginger fill the nose, alongside delicate smoke. The palate offers notes of creamy vanilla, sweet malt and honey-nut cereal.
subtitle:
Irish Single Malt Whiskey
Egan's

name: Fercullen 14 Year Old Single Malt
description: Fercullen 14 Year Old is a sweet, nutty Irish single malt whiskey from Powerscourt Distillery that has been exclusively matured in ex-bourbon barrels. Aromas of honey, vanilla, sweet malt, baking spices, almonds, plums and cinnamon fill the nose, complemented by notes of nutmeg, cinnamon, toasted oat, marzipan, walnuts, sweet malt and caramel throughout the palate.
subtitle:
Single Malt Irish Whiskey 
Distillery Bottling

name: Fercullen 10 Year Old Single Grain
description: A well-balanced single grain Irish whiskey from Fercullen, matured in white oak casks and finished in ex-bourbon casks. Aromas of vanilla, orange, honey, almonds and oak fill the nose, complemented by notes of peaches, marmalade, marzipan, vanilla, caramel and oak spice throughout the palate.
subtitle: Single Grain Irish Whiskey

name: Fercullen 8 Year Old Blended Whiskey
description: Fercullen Eight Year Old is a sweet and fruity blend of malt and grain whiskies from Powerscourt Distillery in County Wicklow, that has been matured in oak casks. Aromas of vanilla, citrus, honey, almonds, oak and candied orange peel fill the nose, complemented by notes of sweet malt, caramel, toasted oak and sweet oranges throughout the palate.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Flaming Pig Black Cask Irish Whiskey
description: A rich and spicy Irish whiskey with a smoky backbone that is made with a blend of single malt and grain whiskies that are married for six months in intensely charred "black" casks. The palate offers notes of caramel, smoky oak, vanilla and peppery spice that linger in the finish.
subtitle: Irish Blended Whiskey

name:
Gelston's Single Pot Still
Pinot Noir Cask
description: Gelston’s creamy, fruity single pot still whiskey finished for 21 months in French oak Pinot noir barriques. This parcel of wine casks came to Ireland from Two Paddock’s in New Zealand’s South Island, a small vineyard owned and operated by actor Sam Neill. This extra maturation has lent the whiskey an extra layer of berries and black pepper on the palate.
subtitle: Irish Single Pot Still Whiskey

name: Gelston's Single Malt
description: A smooth, spicy triple distilled Irish single malt from Gelston's matured in first-fill ex-bourbon casks. Aromas of savoury spice, chocolate-covered hazelnuts and floral malt fill the nose. The palate offers notes of oak spice, vanilla, cassia, burnt caramel and roast nuts, developing hints of marshmallow and honey that linger in the finish.
subtitle: Single Malt Irish Whiskey

name: Gelston's Single Pot Still
description: A citrusy, spicy single pot still whiskey from Gelston’s. Irish single pot still whiskey is made in a similar way to single malt but uses a combination of malted barley and un-malted grains. This is a bright and easy going example of the style with white fruit and butter pastry on the palate.
subtitle: Irish Single Pot Still Whiskey

name: Gelston's 12 Year Old Single Malt
description: A 12-year-old single malt Irish whiskey from Gelston's that offers aromas of lemon-drizzle cake, clove-studded orange and soft spice that fill the nose. The palate offers notes of walnuts, candied pecans, cacao nibs, chocolate orange and sweet porridge that linger in the finish.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whiskey

name: Gelston's Blended Whiskey
description: A blended Irish whiskey from Gelston's, made with a blend of locally sourced Irish malted barley and grain whiskey that is matured in ex-bourbon casks.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Glendalough Double Barrel Single Grain
description:
Glendalough Double Barrel is a single grain Irish whiskey, aged in a combination of bourbon and oloroso sherry casks. Sweet and creamy, with butterscotch and honey from the American oak and dried fruit from the Spanish.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Single Grain Irish Whiskey

name: Glendalough Pot Still
description: A single malt Irish whiskey from Glendalough, made using a traditional pot still and finished in virgin Irish oak casks. The result is a malty, sweet whiskey with notes of honey, oak and ginger on the palate.
subtitle: Single Pot Still Irish Whiskey

name:
Glendalough 7 Year Old
Mizunara Finish
description: A seven-year-old Irish single malt whiskey from Glendalough that was initially matured in ex-bourbon casks before a long finish in Japanese mizunara oak casks. The palate offers notes of dark chocolate, orange oil, sandalwood, cinnamon, lemon zest and green apples that linger in the finish.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whiskey

name:
Green Spot
Single Pot Still
description:
This historic single pot still Irish whiskey used only to be available in Dublin grocer Mitchell's, but now has spread across the world to huge acclaim. A delightful combination of fruit, toffee and malt.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle:
Single Pot Still Irish Whiskey
Distillery Bottling

name:
Green Spot
Leoville Barton Bordeaux Finish
description:
A special edition of Green Spot, this was aged initially in a combination of bourbon- and oloroso-sherry casks before being finished for up to two years in barriques from famed Bordeaux winery Château Léoville Barton. A sweet blend of orchard fruit and spicy flavours.


Spot whiskeys originated in Dublin in the 1800s, Mitchel & Sons gained a reputation for producing the finest single pot still whiskeys, marking casks with coloured dots to signify aging potential.

Tasting Notes (2)
subtitle:
Single Pot Still Irish Whiskey
Distillery Bottling

name:
Green Spot
Chateau Montelena Finish
description: The Mitchell's Spot whiskeys have always had an affinity for wine, and this Green Spot shows that off even further. Rich and spicy triple-distilled pot-still whiskey from Midleton is initially aged in bourbon and sherry casks before being finished for 12 months in casks that used to hold rich red Zinfandel wine from the famed Chateau Montelena in California's Napa Valley. Montelena was bought by Irishman Jim Barrett in the 1970s, and this release celebrates the shared heritage of his wine and Midleton's fine whiskey. It's rich and spicy, with layers of marzipan and toasted oak on top of the pot-still fruit and weightiness.
subtitle: Single Pot Still Irish Whiskey

name:
Green Spot 1991

26 Year Old Marsala Cask TWE Exclusive
description:
A very special bottling, selected by and exclusive to The Whisky Exchange: a single cask of 26-year-old Green Spot pot still whiskey, distilled at Midleton and filled into cask on 18 October 1991. It was initially matured in bourbon and sherry casks, before the spirit was reracked into a single Marsala butt for further maturation. The result brings together the fresh fruit flavours of bourbon-cask maturation with the richer dried fruit notes you get from sherry casks, and stirs them both together with fragrant Marsala and classic Irish pot-still fruit and spice.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Single Pot Still Irish Whiskey

name:
Green Spot 2006

12 Year Old Bourbon Cask TWE Exclusive
description:
Specially selected by and exclusively available from The Whisky Exchange, this single-cask shows why we love Green Spot. Bonded on 27 February 2006 and matured in a single first-fill bourbon cask, it's zingy, fruity and packed with rich pot-still character.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Single Pot Still Irish Whiskey

name: Hinch Pot Still
description: A herbaceous and biscuity triple distilled single pot still Irish whiskey from Hinch. The palate offers notes of tart fruits; plums and blackberries, with hints of zesty oranges and cinnamon spice.
subtitle:
Single Pot Still Irish Whiskey
Distillery Bottling

name: Hinch Small Batch Bourbon Cask Irish Whiskey
description: A small batch Irish whiskey from Hinch that has been matured in ex-bourbon casks, this has notes of creamy vanilla, honey-nut cornflakes and lively citrus throughout the palate.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Hinch Peated Single Malt Whiskey
description: A heavily-peated single malt Irish whiskey from Hinch distillery that was triple distilled and matured in specially-selected oak casks. Aromas of sweet tar, rich smoke, woody spice and malt fill the nose, complemented by notes of aromatic peat, raisins, sultanas, liquorice and rich smoke throughout the palate.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whiskey

name: Hinch 10 Year Old Sherry Cask Finished Irish Whiskey
description: Made by Hinch Distilling Co in Ireland, this 10 Year Old whiskey has been matured in American oak casks, before being finished for at least six months in Oloroso sherry casks from Jerez. A rich, sweet whiskey, it has notes of dried fruit, raisings and creamy vanilla throughout the palate.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Hinch 5 Year Old Double Wood Irish Whiskey
description: From Irish bottler Hinch, this 5-year-old Double Wood has been matured in ex-bourbon casks and finished for at least a year in virgin American oak barrels. It is a smooth, sweet whiskey with notes of vanilla, cinnamon and oak spice throughout the palate.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name:
The Irishman Single Malt
2022 Relaunch
description: A triple-distilled Irish single malt whiskey from The Irishman that has been matured in a combination of ex-bourbon and ex-oloroso sherry casks. Aromas of juicy peaches, dried apricot, tropical fruits, orange blossom and vanilla fudge fill the nose, complemented by notes of vanilla, toasted almonds, honey, crunchy granola, digestive biscuits, rich malt and peppery oak spice throughout the palate.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whiskey

name: The Irishman Caribbean Rum Cask Finish
description: A fruity, exotic Irish whiskey from The Irishman that was initially matured in American oak ex-bourbon barrels and finished in Caribbean rum barrels from the island of St Lucia. Aromas of apricots, summer fruits, pineapple and ginger fill the nose, complemented by notes of mango, banana, pineapple, figs, ginger, cinnamon, vanilla and white pepper throughout the palate.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: The Irishman 12 Year Old Single Malt
description:
The Irishman 12 Year Old Single Malt is aged exclusively in first-fill bourbon casks. Limited to 6,000 bottles each year, this is malty and fruity.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Single Malt Irish Whiskey

name: The Irishman The Harvest
description: Previously known as Founder's Reserve, The Harvest blended Irish whiskey from The Irishman is made with a combination of 70% single malt and 30% single pot still whiskey and matured in American oak ex-bourbon barrels. Aromas of white pepper, green apples, pears, zesty spices and citrus fill the nose, complemented by notes of ripe fruits, vanilla, butterscotch, toffee, cracked peppercorns, nutmeg and clove throughout the palate and lingering in the finish.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name:
The Irishman Cask Strength
Bot.2021
description: The 2021 release of The Irishman Cask Strength Irish whiskey has been matured in specially-selected American oak casks, creating aromas of candied oranges and cherries that fill the nose. The palate offers notes of clove, nutmeg, toasted hazelnuts and fresh berries that linger in the finish.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name:
The Irishman 2004 Single Malt
 17 Year Old Sherry Cask
description: A 17-year-old Irish single malt whiskey from The Irishman, matured in first-fill sherry casks, creating aromas of dark chocolate, dried fruit and honey on the nose, complemented by notes of toasted oak, raisins, sherry, roasted hazelnuts and dark chocolate.
subtitle: Single Malt Irish Whiskey

name: Jameson Black Barrel
description:
A special pot still whiskey-heavy version of Jameson. Black Barrel has lots of first-fill bourbon and sherry casks in the mix, giving it a much richer flavour than regular Jameson, with a strong sherried note.

Tasting Notes (2)
subtitle: Irish Blended Whiskey

name: Jameson Crested
description: Crested is the new name for Jameson's Crested Ten with an updated look, but the same blend. This is made with older aged Jameson with a high measure of pure pot-still whiskey in the mix, a fair proportion of which has been aged in sherry casks to add spicy sweetness.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Jameson Caskmates Stout Edition
description:
Jameson Caskmates sees the reuse of old whiskey barrels. Nothing new in that, but in between, they've been used to age stout from Cork's Franciscan Well brewery. This has added notes of cocoa, coffee and butterscotch to this classic Irish whiskey.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Jameson Caskmates IPA Edition
description: The second release in Jameson Caskmates range, finished this time in casks that once held zesty IPA. The combination adds further layers of hop fruitiness to the whiskies already fruity character as well as a touch of citrus, floral notes and some balancing bitterness. Perfect for a boilermaker – sip of IPA, sip of Jameson Caskmates, repeat.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name:
Jameson Irish Whiskey
Bar Bottle
description: A 1.5 litre bottle of the massively popular Jameson Irish Whiskey. The label is placed upside down to be the correct way up when the bottle is placed on a bar optic. One of Jim Murray's favourites, with 95 points in the Whisky Bible 2013.

subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

description:
Hugely popular Irish blend, renowned for its affinity with ginger ale. The default springboard into the fascinating world of Irish whiskey, Jameson's quality has improved massively in the last 10-15 years and it's one of Jim Murray's favourites, with 95 points in the Whisky Bible 2013.

A well-balanced single pot still Irish whiskey, Redbreast 12 Year Old has been matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks, creating a sweet-and-spicy character. The palate offers notes of black pepper, peaches, chocolate chips, cinnamon and dry oak spice, with hints of honey and orange lingering in the finish.
subtitle: Irish Single Pot Still Whiskey

name:
Sailor's Home Caravelle 10 Year Old
Rum Finish The Island Series
description: The second release in the Sailor's Home Island Series, Caravelle is named after the type of ship used for long voyages through the 15th, 16th and 17th centuries, and for Presqu’ile de la Caravelle - a wild and lush natural reserve in Martinique. Matured for at least a decade in American oak ex-bourbon casks, Caravelle has been finished in Martinique Rhum Agricole casks, creating aromas of pineapple, dry savannah grass and demerara sugar on the nose. The palate offers notes of creamy toffee, green sugar cane, blood orange, liquorice and candied bananas throughout the palate.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Sexton Single Malt Irish Whiskey
description: A well-balanced single malt Irish whiskey, Sexton has been created by master distiller Alex Thomas and is made with 100% Irish malted barley. It is triple distilled before being aged in ex-oloroso sherry casks, giving it a rich, fruity character with notes of honeycomb.
subtitle: Single Malt Irish Whiskey

name: Shortcross Rye and Malt Irish Whiskey
description: A fruity, spicy Irish whiskey from Shortcross that is made with a combination of malted rye and malted barley, and is double-distilled in copper pot stills, before being matured in a combination of ex-bourbon barrels and virgin chinkapin oak casks. Aromas of orange peel, caramel, creamy fudge and soft spices fill the nose, complemented by notes of stem ginger, fresh apricot, green apples and dark honey throughout the palate.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: The Legendary Dark Silkie Irish Whiskey
description: A rich and smoky blended Irish whiskey from Sliabh Liag Distillers, Dark Silkie is an ode to Donegal whiskies of the past. Made with a combination of triple distilled peated Irish single malts, Irish single malts and smooth grain whiskey, it has aromas of fresh apple, pear, peppery smoke and oak spice on the nose. The palate offers notes of salted caramel, pipe tobacco, liquorice, dark chocolate, toffee and pears.

Carefully crafted to honour the beautiful Donegal coastline and the magical creatures said to reside there, Silkie blended Irish whiskey aims to be just as beguiling as the Silkies themselves, with its soft mouth feel and its rich and warming flavour.

Matured in a combination of virgin oak, refill and ex-sherry casks, aromas of toasted oak, vanilla, dried fruit, crunchy apples and soft baking spices fill the nose and are echoed throughout the palate.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Slane Irish Whiskey
description: Slane is a blended Irish whiskey aged in a combination of virgin-oak, refill-American-whiskey and oloroso-sherry casks. The result is an elegant and spicy dram with notes of caramel, dried fruit, caramel and butterscotch.
subtitle: Irish Blended Whiskey

description: A sweet and spicy small-batch single malt Irish whiskey that has been finished in ex-ginger beer casks from Umbrella London. The casks were hand-selected by Teeling master distiller Alex Chasko and sent to Umbrella London where they held its fiery ginger beer for two years, before finding their way back to Teeling. Aromas of creamy vanilla, spicy ginger and fresh citrus fill the nose, complemented by notes of sweet malt, sticky molasses, fresh ginger, apples, oranges and peppery oak spice throughout the palate.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whiskey

name: Teeling Small Batch Whiskey
description: Since the Teelings parted company with Cooley, the company they started, we've been waiting for their return and here it is – Teeling Whiskey. Finished in rum casks and bottled at 46% without chill-filtration, it's an excellent statement of intent. The blend is said to contain a high proportion of first-fill bourbon cask whiskey, and a higher-than-normal ratio of malt to grain.

Aromas of vanilla, stewed apples, cinnamon, apricot yoghurt and banana milkshake fill the nose, alongside rich sherry aromas. The palate offers notes of toasted barley, salted caramel, dark fruit, winter spice and rich nuts, with hint of red apples and milk chocolate.

name: Tullamore Dew 18 Year Old
description: A limited edition of fewer than 2500 bottles from Tullamore DEW, made up of 18-year-old whiskey that was finished in a complex combination of oloroso sherry, port, madeira and bourbon casks. It's a spicy dram with a rich seam of fruity flavour running through the middle.
subtitle: Single Malt Irish Whiskey

name:
Tullamore Dew 12 Year Old
Special Reserve
description: A 12yo blended Irish whiskey from duty-free favourite Tullamore Dew, Special Reserve has been assembled from a mixture of bourbon and oloroso sherry casks.
subtitle: Irish Blended Whiskey

name: Tullamore Dew 14 Year Old
description: A single malt released under the Tullamore DEW label, triple distilled in the Irish tradition and then finished in a range of different casks: bourbon, oloroso sherry, port and madeira. The result is a complex and spicy whiskey with creamy and fruity notes.
subtitle: Single Malt Irish Whiskey

name: Tullamore Dew
description:
Tullamore Dew is a resoundingly popular Irish blend, particularly in overseas markets, where it is second only to Jameson. Very approachable.

An unusual bottle of Tullamore Dew from the 1970s, when having very light whiskey was what everyone wanted.

subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Two Stacks Smoke & Mirrors Peated Single Malt Stout Cask
description: A peated Irish whiskey from Two Stacks that has been matured in a combination of ex-bourbon and ex-imperial stout casks, creating a complex, well-balanced character. Aromas of honeydew melons, sweet barley, rhubarb, peach, toffee and soft peat smoke fill the nose, complemented by notes of honey, dry peat, white peaches, dark chocolate and creamy vanilla throughout the palate.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whisky

name: Two Stacks The Blender's Cut Sauternes Cask Finish
description: A limited-edition Irish whiskey from Two Stacks that was initially matured in a combination of virgin oak, ex-bourbon and ex-sherry casks, before being finished in a single French oak cask that previously held Sauternes wine from Bordeaux. The palate offers notes of honeysuckle, cinnamon, nutmeg and crystalised ginger.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Two Stacks The Blender's Cut Cask Strength
description: A sweet and spicy cask strength blended Irish whiskey from Two Stacks, The Blenders Cut is made with a combination of grain, malt and pot still whiskies, including a small amount of peated malt whiskey, matured in a combination of virgin oak, ex-bourbon and ex-oloroso sherry casks.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whisky

name: Two Stacks The First Cut
description: A sweet and spicy blended Irish whiskey from Two Stacks, The First Cut is made with a combination of grain, malt and pot still whiskies, including a small amount of peated malt whiskey, matured in a combination of virgin oak, ex-bourbon and ex-oloroso sherry casks.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Tyrconnell Single Malt
description:
A superb Irish single malt, with a creamy character and a wonderfully smooth palate. Very drinkable.

Tasting Notes (2)
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whiskey

name:
Whisky Agency Irish Malt 1989
27 Year Old for TWE
description: A very limited run of gorgeous, long-aged Irish whiskey, bottled exclusively for us by The Whisky Agency. The late 80s and early 90s were a sweet spot for whiskey from this anonymous Irish distillery, with a huge amount of fruity flavour in every bottling. This one zeroes in on mangoes, and is one of the juiciest drams we've ever tried. A must-taste for fans of the style.
subtitle:
Irish Single Malt Whiskey
The Whisky Agency

name: Waterford Gaia Organic 2.1
description: Batch 2.1 of Waterford's Gaia Organic Irish single malt whiskey is part of a series which champions farmers that are growing barley with sustainable methods that respect the land and prioritise flavour over yield. Gaia Organic 2.1 is made with barley harvested in 2016 and offers aromas of orange peel, freshly-baked bread, milk chocolate, fig rolls, lavender, marshmallows and buttermilk that fill the nose, complemented by notes of white pepper, grapefruit, liquorice, cherries, dark chocolate, toast, peaches and lemon zest throughout the palate.
subtitle:
Irish Single Malt Whisky
Distillery Bottling

name: Waterford The Cuvee
description: Hotly anticipated single malt from Waterford. The terroir focused operation began work in 2014, filling casks with spirit distilled from barley grown at individual farms around Ireland. With this landmark release, the Waterford team have drawn on their mature stocks of single origin whisky and married them together, balancing the flavours derived from different terroirs to create depth and balance. The result is a characterful dram, oily in texture and slightly spicy with gingerbread and clove alongside fresh apple, marmalade and toasted grains.
subtitle:
Irish Single Malt Whiskey
Distillery Bottling

name: Waterford Hook Head 1.1
description: Hook Head 1.1 is part of Waterford's Single Farm Origin series and is made exclusively with Irish Propino barley from Hook Head farm's 2015 harvest. Matured in a variety of casks, including first-fill bourbon barrels, virgin American oak and French oak casks for three years and eight months.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: Waterford Luna 1.1 Biodynamic
description: One for the history books: this is the first single malt ever to be made from biodynamic barley. The approach to framing proposed by Rudolf Steiner treats a piece of land and the crops thereon as a single organism to be kept healthy and harmonious. This ground-breaking dram is remarkably vibrant and expressive, showing white fruit, wildflower honey and citrusy notes of farmhouse ale on the nose. The perfumed notes then gives way to a palate of apple pie, lemon zest and stony minerality.
subtitle:
Irish Single Malt Whiskey
Distillery Bottling

name: Waterford Lakefield 1.1
description: The first release of Lakefield Irish single malt whiskey from Waterford is part of its Single Farm Origin range. Made with barley harvested in 2016, Lakefield 1.1 was matured in a variety of casks for three and a half years before being bottled. The palate offers notes of apple crumble, stewed rhubarb and clove that linger in the finish.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: Waterford Grattansbrook 1.1
description: An Irish single malt whiskey from Waterford's Single Farm Origin series, made exclusively with barley from Grattansbrook farm and matured for three years in a variety of casks. Aromas of marzipan, white grapes and lemon zest fill the nose, complemented by notes of raisins, chocolate spread, brown sugar, orange zest, cinnamon, ginger and banana throughout the palate.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whiskey

name: Waterford Ballymorgan 1.2
description: The second release of Ballymorgan Single Farm Origin Irish single malt whiskey from Waterford is made exclusively with barley grown by Robert Milne in County Wexford. Fruity aromas of orange, mango and treacle fill the nose, complemented by notes of cinnamon, nutmeg and fresh malt on the palate.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: Waterford Sheestown 1.2
description: A Single Farm Origin single malt Irish whiskey from Waterford, Sheestown 1.2 is made exclusively with barley grown by Phillip O'Brien in Sheestown, Kilkenny. Softly spiced aromas of cinnamon, black pepper and cooked pears fill the nose, complemented by notes of malted barley, vanilla, apples and caraway throughout the palate.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: Waterford Gaia Organic 1.1
description: The first organic Irish single malt whiskey from Waterford, Gaia 1.1 is made using 100% organic barley grown on seven different farms in Ireland. It has been matured in a combination of ex-bourbon, virgin American oak, French oak and Vin Doux Naturel wine casks creating a fruity, spicy character.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: Waterford Ballymorgan 1.1
description: The barley used to make Waterford Ballymorgan 1.1 Single Farm Origin Irish whiskey was grown in County Wexford, just an hour away from the distillery and matured in a combination of French and American oak casks.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: Waterford Sheestown 1.1
description: Sheestown 1.1 is a single farm origin Irish whiskey from Waterford, made with barley grown just outside of the historic town of Kilkenny. Matured in a combination of French and American oak casks.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: Waterford Ballykilcavan 1.2
description: Ballykilcavan Edition 1.2 from Waterford is made with 100% Taberna barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis west of the Barrow in County Laois. Distilled in 2016 and matured in a combination French and American oak casks for three months longer than Edition 1.1.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: Waterford Bannow Island 1.2
description: Part of the second wave of whiskies from Waterford, Bannow Island 1.2 is made using barley grown on the extreme southern coast of County Wexford by Ed Harpur. Aromas of pears, green apples, salted toffee, toasted barley and vanilla on the nose, as well as vanilla, white grapes and white pepper. The palate offers notes of apple crumble, cinnamon, toffee, lime zest and ginger, followed by butterscotch, white grapes and white pepper.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: Waterford Ballykilcavan 1.1
description: One of two inaugural releases from Waterford in Ireland, a distillery dedicated to showcasing the character that different farms and their terroir can give to whisky. Ballykilcavan farm is in the middle of a wood, with rich soil and protection for wind perfect for growing barley. The resulting whisky is punchy and sweet, run through with fruit and spicy grain.
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: Waterford Bannow Island 1.1
description:
One of the inaugural releases from Ireland's Waterford distillery, focusing on the differences in soil and terroir across the country. Bannow Island Edition 1.1 is made from barley grown by the sea, with the grain battered by salty breezes as it grows. Unsurprisingly it has a touch of brininess as part of its layered, complex and easy-drinking character.

Tasting Notes (1)
subtitle: Irish Single Malt Whisky

name: West Cork Bog Oak Charred Cask
description: A triple distilled single malt Irish whiskey from West Cork Distillers, initially matured in ex-sherry casks and finished in charred bog oak casks. These casks are made using oak sourced from the local boglands of Glengarriff. Aromas of warm spice, leather and dried fruit fill the nose, complimented by notes of malt, cracked black pepper and baking spices throughout the palate.
subtitle: Single Malt Irish Whiskey

name: West Cork Black Cask
description: A well-balanced blended Irish whiskey from West Cork Distillers, Black Cask is aged in first-fill bourbon casks for three years and finished for a further year in heavily charred bourbon casks. The palate is a balance of black pepper spice, creamy vanilla, fiery ginger and caramel, with hints of orange lingering in the finish.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Writers Tears Ulysses
description: A limited-edition blended Irish whiskey from Writers Tears, Ulysses commemorates the centenary of James Joyce's Ulysses and is presented in a stylish bottled designed by Studio Minerva, London. Aromas of apple, vanilla, honey and pot still spice fill the nose, complemented by notes of ginger, butterscotch, toasted oak, milk chocolate and toasted almonds throughout the palate.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Writers Tears Red Head
description: A fruity single malt Irish whiskey from Writer's Tears, Read Head is matured exclusively in oloroso sherry casks, creating aromas of candied orange peel, chocolate covered marzipan, dried fruit and praline that fill the nose. The palate offers notes of rich nuts, Christmas cake, tangy pineapple, liquorice and melted milk chocolate, with walnuts and baking spice lingering in the finish.
subtitle: Single Malt Irish Whiskey

name: Writers Tears Copper Pot
description: Writers Tears Copper Pot Blend is a combination of pure pot still and malt whiskeys from an unnamed Cork distillery. Jim Murray gave this one 93 points.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Writers Tears Double Oak
description: Writers Tears Double oak marries both single malt and single pot still whiskies that have been matured in American oak casks and French oak Cognac casks from France's Allary Cooperage. Aromas of stewed fruits, earthy vanilla and apple crumble fill the nose, complemented by notes of white peaches, lychee, lemon peel, grapes and dark chocolate throughout the palate.
subtitle: Blended Irish Whiskey

name: Yellow Spot 12 Year Old
description:
A second entry into the 'Spot' range, aged for 12 years and made up in part from spirit matured in Malaga casks for a sweet and moreish dram.
